import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("../input/have-you-ever-eaten-these-foods/responses.csv")

df = df.drop(["Race", "Home location", "Gender"], axis="columns")

pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)
source.c24bd49f:
# I'll assume that the NaN values are false and replacing them in the dataframe
df = df.fillna(0)
source.a910f18b:
def plotByAge(col):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    df.groupby(['age']).mean()[col].plot(ax=ax)
    ax.set_xlabel("age")
    ax.set_ylabel(col)
source.ead61560: Observing from plots of various food items verses age groups, the tendency to explore new food increases with age.
source.7bd5913b: The data seems to suggest that there is a tendency to consume more amount of food as you grow older.
